intro: Tournefortia gardneri, commonly known as the Hawaiian tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in coastal and lowland habitats, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
